image.title: CiTR -- All Awesome In Your Ears

item.title: Transmission #48
item.description:
1. Dan Deacon - Snake Mistakes (Spiderman of the Rings) <Jan.21 / 2008 @ Richards on Richards>
2. Radiohead - Idioteque (Kid A) <Aug.19 / 2008 @ Thunderbird Stadium>
3. Battles - Snare Hangar (Mirrored) <Sept.2 / 2008 @ Richards on Richards>
4. The Presets - I Go Hard, I Go Home (Beams) <Oct.9 / 2008 @ The Commodore>
5. Cut Copy - Nobody Lost, Nobody Found (In Ghost Colors) <Oct.9 / 2008 @ The Commodore>
6. M83 - We Own The Sky (Saturday = Youth) <Nov.26 / 2008 @ Richards on Richards>
7. Miike Snow - Animal <Fake Blood Remix> <Dec.18 / 2008 @ Republic>
8. Women - Eye Sore (Public Strain) <April.2 / 2009 @ The WISE Hall>
9. TV on the Radio - Young Liars (Young Liars EP) <May.25 / 2009 @ The Malkin Bowl>
item.itunes:subtitle: MBot and SBot Love Live Music: Shows Weve Seen Together since the last time we had a show on Shows Weve Seen Together OR A Full-Circuit Celebration of On-Air Awesomeness for the last All Awesome in your Ears

item.title: Transmission #47
item.description:
6 Colors 9 Songs One Super Gay Show
Happy Pride Robots!
RED Azeda Booth - "In RED" (In Flesh Tones) M83 - "Run Into Flowers" (Dead Cities, RED Seas & Lost Ghosts)
ORANGE Deerhoof - "That Big ORANGE Sun Run Over Speed Light" (Milk Man)
YELLOW Clap Your Hands Say Yeah - "The Skin Of My YELLOW Country Teeth" (Clap Your Hands Say Yeah)
GREEN Memory Tapes - "GREEN Knight" (Seek Magic) Dan Deacon - "Trippy GREEN Skull" (Spiderman Of The Rings)
BLUE Modest Mouse - "Baby BLUE Sedan" (Building Something Out Of Nothing) Max Tundra - "Glycaemic Index BLUE" (Parallax Error Beheads You)
PURPLE Animal Collective - "The PURPLE Bottle" (Feels)
item.itunes:subtitle: MBot and SBot Take Pride: A Robotronic Rainbow Parade (Note: The podcast didn't work... again... but at least you can see tracklist!)

Four Tet - "Sing" (There Is Love In You) 5. Owen Pallett - "Lewis Takes Off His Shirt" <Dan Deacon Remix> (Lewis Takes Off His Shirt EP) 6. Washed Out - "You'll See It" (Life of Leisure) 7. item.itunes:subtitle: Robo-Boogie: A dedication to songs guaranteed to spin your gears and fire up your jet packs!

item.title: Transmission #42
item.description:
MBot and SBot were sad that they didn't make it to the final step of the Word Game Poetry Project last transmission. So they decided to play again.
The Shins - "The PAST and Pending" (Oh! Inverted WORLD)
- WORLD -
Local Natives - "WORLD NEWS" (Gorilla Manor)
- NEWS -
Modest Mouse - "The Good Times Are Killing ME" (Good NEWS For People Who Love Bad News)
- ME -
TV on the Radio - "Wolf Like ME" (Return to Cookie MOUNTAIN)
- MOUNTAIN -
The Unicorns - "Ghost MOUNTAIN" (Who WILL Cut Our Hair When We're Gone?)
- WILL -
Yeah YEAH Yeahs - "Head's WILL Roll" (It's Blitz)
- YEAH -
The Rapture - "Whoo! Alright YEAH... Uh Huh" (PIECES of the People We Love)
- PIECES -
Junior Boys - "Bits & Pieces" (Begone Dull Care)
- & - (which brings us back to...)
Neutral Milk Hotel - "King of Carrot Flowers Parts 2 & 3" (In The Aeroplane Over The Sea)
** For the record, that makes the two of us CHAMPION BOTS.
item.itunes:subtitle: Will? - Me? Yeah? - PAST WORLD NEWS! (& mountain pieces...): An Artist to Song Word Game Poetry Project (part two - a continuation)

item.title: Transmission #41
item.description:
Neutral MILK Hotel - "Two-Headed Boy" (In The Aeroplane Over The Sea)
- MILK -
Deerhoof - "MILK Man" (Milk MAN)
- MAN -
MAN Man - "BLACK Mission Goggles" (Six Demon Bag)
- BLACK -
DEATH From Above 1979 - "BLACK History Month" <Girl on Girl Revision ft. Final Fantasy> (Romance Bloody Romance: Remixes and B-Sides)
- DEATH -
Explosions In The SKY - "The Birth And DEATH Of The Day" (All Of A Sudden I Miss Everyone)
- SKY -
ANIMAL Collective - "What Would I Want? SKY" (Fall Be Kind)
- ANIMAL -
Of Montreal - "The PAST Is A Grotesque ANIMAL" (Hissing Fauna, Are You The Destroyer?)
** For the record, we didn't make it to the last step. But it would have been:
- PAST -
The Shins - "The PAST and Pending" (Oh! Inverted World)
item.itunes:subtitle: MILK MAN! Black - Death - Sky (animal past): An Artist to Song Word Game Poetry Project (part one)

item.title: Transmission #37
item.description:
picture little SBot on Xmas morning, opening his presents in a pair of onesie pajamas:
1. The Chipmunks - "The Chipmunks Song (Christmas Don't Be Late)" (The Chipmunks Song (Christmas Don't Be Late) 7" Single) 2. Vince Guaraldi Trio - "O Tannenbaum" (A Charlie Brown Christmas) 3. Vince Guaraldi Trio - "Christmas Time Is Here (Vocal Version)" (A Charlie Brown Christmas) 4. The Caroleers - "Who's That Up On The Roof?" (Santa Claus Is Coming To Town) 5. The Caroleers - "I Want An Elephant For Christmas" (Santa Claus Is Coming To Town)
now imagine not-so-little MBot flying home for the holidays, puking her robo-guts out at the airport because she drank a bit too much Xmas cheer the night before:
6. Kokopelli Choir - "Sweet Sweet Spirit" (Believe) 7. Hawksley Workman - "First Snow Of The Year" (Almost A Full Moon) 8. M83 - "Skin Of The Night" (Saturdays = Youth) 9. Fake Blood - "Blood Splashing" (Mars 12" Single) 10. MSTRKRFT - "Bounce (ft. N.O.R.E and Isis)" (Fist Of God)
item.itunes:subtitle: The Ghosts of Robots Past: An Xmas Story (as outputted by MBot and Sbot in progression of 12/25s)

item.title: All Awesome In Your Ears - The Stereoscopic Redoubt Addition
item.itunes:subtitle: Hosted by DBot for CITR's Second Annual Show Swap Week!

item.title: Rainbow Groove - The All Awesome In Your Ears Addition
item.description:
For CiTR's Second Annual Show Swap Week!
The Bot's version of Disco/Funk History in Chronological Order:
1977: Steely Dan - "Peg" (Aja) 1977: Arpadys - "Stone Roller" (Monkey Star) 1978: Soraya - "If" (Disco Star) 1978: Musique - "In The Bush" (Keep on Jumpin') 1979: Vernon Burch - "Get Up" (Get Up) 1981: Bohannon - "Take The Country To NY City" (Take The Country To NY City 12" Single) 1981: Ahzz - "New Yorks Movin" (New Yorks Movin' 12" Single) 1985: Alexander Robotnick - "Problems D'Amour" (Problems D'Amour 12" Single) 2005: Hot Chip - "Down With Prince" (Coming On Strong) 2006: Herbert - "Moving Like A Train" (Scale) 2007: Of Montreal - "Gronlandic Edit" (Hissing Fauna, Are You The Destroyer?) 2008: Hercules and Love Affair - "Blind (Frankie Knuckles Remix)"
item.itunes:subtitle: Hosted by MBot "Funktron Obliviator" and SBot "Discobot Annihilator"

item.title: Transmission #24
item.description:
An Anniversary Present for One Whole Year on Air!
SBot (pulled chronologically and almost entirely from Wedge Episode Feb.11/2004):
1. Hayden - "As Bad As They Seem" (Everything I Long For) 2. Blur - "Coffee and TV" (13) 3. Beck - "Lost Cause" (Sea Change) 4. Reindeer Section - "You Are My Joy" (Son of Evil Reindeer) 5. My Bloody Valentine - "Only Shallow" (Loveless)
MBot (likes her Wedge a little more all over the place):
6. The Dandy Warhols - "Bohemian Like You" (Thirteen Tales Form Urban Bohemia) 7. Elliot Brood - "Second Son" (Ambassador) - Nov.18/2005 8. Germans - "I Am The Teacher" (Cape Fear) 9. Broken Social Scene - "Cause=Time" (You Forgot It In People) - Oct.17/2003 10. Sigur Ros - "Untitled 1" (Untitled) - Feb.21/2003
item.itunes:subtitle: A Cyber-Salute to Music Videos Part 2: The Wedge - A Reboot in the Right Direction

item.itunes:subtitle: The Bots are now Legal in the State (and Anything New is Everything Good, and Everything New is What We're Playing)

item.title: Transmission #20
item.description:
1. Dan Deacon (of course) - "Get Older" (Bromst)
who toured throughout 2007 and 2008 with
2. Girl Talk - "Don't Stop" (Feed The Animals)
who did a remix of "Knife" by
3. Grizzly Bear - "While You Wait For The Others" (Veckatimest)
and because Grizzly Bears have
4. Handsome Furs - "All We Want Baby, Is Everything" (Face Control)
one half of which is made up of Dan Boekner, who is also in Wolf Parade with Spencer Krug. And Spencer Krug is also a member of the ultimate Canadian indie supergroup
5. Swan Lake - "Spanish Gold, 2044" (Enemy Mine)
who are on Jagjagwar with
6. Minus Story - "The Way Beyond" (My Ion Truss)
who recorded their latest album at Electrical Audio in Chicago where
7. The Owls have also recorded - "Channel" (Daughters and Suns)
who are on Magic Marker Records with
8. Hello Seahorse! - "Won't Say Anything" (Hoy A Las Ocho)
who are playing the South by Southwest Festival this year, where
9. Matmos played last year - "Rainbow Flag" (Supreme Balloon)
who played at the Big Ears Festival this year in Knoxville with
10. Dan Deacon - "Woof Woof" (Bromst)
Bonus "Let's Get New Dan Deacon Out Of Our System" Tracks: 11. Dan Deacon - "Wet Wings" (Bromst) 12. Dan Deacon - "Snookered" (Bromst)
item.itunes:subtitle: Dan Deacon to Dan Deacon Version 2.0: The Bots Strike Back

item.title: Transmission #19
item.description:
1. Dan Deacon - "The Crystal Cat" (Spiderman of the Rings)
who is on Carpark Records with
2. Beach House - "D.A.R.L.I.N.G" (Devotion)
who are playing a show in Austin on March.21st with
3. Explosions in the Sky - "What Do You Go Home To?" (All of a Sudden I Miss Everyone)
who share the European label Bella Union with
4. Midlake - "Young Bride" (The Trails of Van Occupanther)
who are on World's Fair Records, which happens to also be the label that produces the "Fabriclive" series (live DJ sets recorded at the London club Fabric) - one of which include
5. Rusko - "C'est La Vie" (N/A)
who did a remix of
6. Kid Sister - "Pro Nails" (Dreamdate)
who is sharing the same stage (although on different days) at the South by Southwest Festival with
7. Max Tundra - "Orphaned" (Parallax Error Behead You)
who is on Domino Records, and they just signed
8. Dirty Projectors - "Rise Above" (Rise Above)
who toured last year with
9. Ponytail - "Beg Waves" (Ice Cream Spiritual)
whose drummer is also the drummer for Ultimate Reality - the joint project from Wham City Collective members Jimmy Roche and
10. Dan Deacon - "Get Older" (Bromst)
BOOYA!
item.itunes:subtitle: Dan Deacon to Dan Deacon in 10 Easy Steps: A Full Circuit Exploration

item.title: Transmission # 12
item.description:
Guest Starring Topstron
SBot: Robo-Hearts Can't Be Broken: Color me calculated in long division with lazer beams blazing. 1. The Cave Singers - "Seeds of Night" (Invitation Songs) 2. Love Is All - "Give It Back" (100 Things Keep Me Up At Night) 3. Deerhunter - "Nothing Ever Happened" (Mircocastle)
Topstron: Music to Appease Robots: Humans just want to be friends, so I baked y'all a cake of Synth Pop. 1. Plastic Bertrand - "Ca Plane Our Moi" (7" Single) 2. Yellow Music Orchestra - "Behind The Mask" (Solid State Survivor) 3. Neil Young - "Transformer Man" (Trans)
MBot: I'll Pass On The Synth Cake: I'm too busy chewing my Bubble Gum Twee Pop 1. Chairlift - "Bruises" (Does You Inspire You) 2. I'm From Barcelona - "Mingus" (Who Killed Harry Houdini) 3. The Boy Least Likely To - "Apple Wagon" (The Best Party Ever)

item.title: Transmission #8 and Mondo Trasho (the robo edition)
item.description:
CTRL-ALT-SAV (SBot): An ode to 5 years of 1 song per year mutual admiration (no upgrades necessary)
for: M.E. Lone-Bot (the only Bot brought forth by the Glove-tron)
1. Mason Jennings - "Nothing" (Mason Jennings) 2. The Shins - "New Slang" (Oh, Inverted World) 3. Wilco - "Jesus, etc." (Yankee Foxtrot Hotel) 4. Flaming Lips - "Fight Test" (Yoshimi Battles the Pink Robots) 5. Modest Mouse - "Dashboard" (We Were Dead Before The Ship Even Sank)
CTRL-ALT-DEL (MBot): An ode to Microsoft Vista - sometimes operating systems should just be obsolete and forgotten
6. The Soft Pink Truth - "Coat Check" (Do You Party?) for: Dan the other Automater 7. Neutral Milk Hotel - "Ghost" (In The Aeroplane Over The Sea) for: T the Turbo-tron that Triumps over "S" (despite the fact that it comes afterwards) 8. The Samuel Jackson Five - "Easily Misunderstood" (Easily Misunderstood) for: Edgar - a discontinued model with one mitten missing 9. Bright Eyes - "First Day of My Life" (I'm Wide Awake It's Morning) for: K. Machine 10. Cut Copy - "Heats on Fire" (Calvin Harris Remix) for: N-tendo
-----------------------------------------------------
Mondo Trasho (the robo edition): Sometimes robots gotta fill in for Maxwells
1. Radiohead - "Idioteque" (Kid A) 2. Matmos - "Exciter Lamp and the Variable Band" (Supreme Balloon) 3. Matmos - "Steam and Sequins for Larry Leven" (The Rose Has Teeth in the Mouth of a Beast) 4. Herbet - "Something Isn't Right" (Scale) 5. Noze - "Remember Love" (Trapez) 6. Secret Mommy - "Tennis Court" (Very Rec) 7. Dan Deacon - "Snake Mistakes" (Spiderman of the Rings)
